definition: Marshall (name)/George Catlett Marshall (1880-1959), US general in WWII and Secretary of State 1947-1949, author of the postwar Marshall plan for Europe and Nobel peace laureate
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
to rest/to take a break/to stop/to halt/(dialect) to sleep/a moment/a short while

sentences.english: Do you mean the Performing Arts Theater on Marshall Street?
sentences.chinese: 你是指在马歇尔街的表演艺术剧院吗？

sentences.english: Teaching kids how to budget and save is key, Marshall says.
sentences.chinese: 马歇尔认为，问题的关键是应教孩子如何花钱和存钱。

sentences.english: Marshall stopped fooling around with other girls when he met Jessica.
sentences.chinese: 自从遇见杰西卡，马歇尔就不再与其他女孩胡来了。

sentences.english: Marshall returned to the United States with a bold new idea.
sentences.chinese: 马歇尔带著大胆的新计画回到美国。

sentences.english: Marshell hammer is used to conduct itscompacting experiment.
sentences.chinese: 可采用马歇尔锤进行击实试验。

sentences.english: Marshall was small and wiry, with bright dancing eyes.
sentences.chinese: 马歇尔个头不高，短小精悍，明亮的眼睛一闪一闪的。

sentences.english: Mr. Marshall was an electrician with elegant manners.
sentences.chinese: 马歇尔先生是个有着优雅风度的电学家。

sentences.english: Campground, The French Broad River, Asheville, North Carolina.
sentences.chinese: 北卡罗莱纳州，马歇尔，法国布罗德河，野营地。

sentences.english: "We have given you a major fashion moment, " says Marshall.
sentences.chinese: “我们给了你们一个重要的潮流时刻，”马歇尔说。

sentences.english: None of these groups ever developed a significant population base in Marshalltown.
sentences.chinese: 这些群体在马歇尔敦人口中的比例始终有限。

sentences.english: Mr. Marshall's eloquent words impressed his boss very much.
sentences.chinese: 马歇尔先生有说服力的话让老板印象非常深刻。

sentences.english: I think there should be two rooms booked for us? In the names of Tony Marshall and May Hunter.
sentences.chinese: 我们订了两间房，名字是托尼o马歇尔和梅o亨特。

sentences.english: Mr. Marshall was an electrician with elegant manners. He mastered electrical engineering.
sentences.chinese: 马歇尔先生是个有着优雅风度的电学家。

sentences.english: The second part is about the release of the Marshall Plan and the initial reaction of Britain.
sentences.chinese: 第二章论述了马歇尔计划的提出与英国的初步反应。

sentences.english: This was what Marshall had meant when he talked of "a cure rather than a palliative, " nothing less.
sentences.chinese: 而这正是马歇尔“要治本而不要治标”的本意。

definition: Roosevelt (name)/Theodore Roosevelt (1858-1919), US President 1901-1909/Franklin D. Roosevelt (1882-1945), US President 1933-1945
Hofmann or Hoffman (name)/August Wilhelm von Hofmann (1818-1892), German chemist/Dustin Hoffman (1937-), US film actor
Wedemeyer (name)/Albert Coady Wedemeyer (1897-1989), US Army commander
